ECSchema.description: Classes for defining the Spatial Structure Hierarchy of a project or asset.

ECEntityClass.description: An bis:SpatialLocation that organizes bis:SpatialElements using 'SpatialOrganizerHoldsSpatialElements' and 'SpatialOrganizerReferencesSpatialElements'

ECRelationshipClass.description: Organizes bis:SpatialElements such that each bis:SpatialElement is 'held' by zero or one 'organizer'.
Organizes bis:SpatialElements such that each bis:SpatialElement can be 'referenced' by zero or more 'organizers'.

ECEntityClass.description: An Element used to form a spatial breakdown structure. As an ISpatialOrganizer, it may explicitly 'hold' or 'reference' SpatialElements.

ECProperty.description: A human-readable description of this Spatial Structure Element

ECRelationshipClass.displayLabel: Spatial Structure Element Aggregates Spatial Structure Elements
ECRelationshipClass.description: Forms the Spatial Structure. The volumes of the aggregated Elements should not overlap and should generally add up to the volume of the aggregator (the aggregating Element) and lie spatially within the aggregator.

ECEntityClass.description: Further specializes a particular subclass of a Spatial Structure Element by associating a custom Type that can be defined by users.

ECProperty.description: A human-readable description of this type.

ECRelationshipClass.displayLabel: Spatial Structure Element Is Of Spatial Structure Element Type
ECRelationshipClass.description: Relates a Spatial Structure Element to its Type definition

ECEntityClass.description: A geographic region in which a Site or smaller Region is situated. Their geometry is typically given as a 2D boundary, but may be given as a 3D volume.
Further specializes a particular subclass of a Region by associating a custom Type that can be defined by users.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relates a Region to its Type definition

ECEntityClass.description: The spatial location of a geographic site on which a Facility is situated. Its geometry may be given at least as a point, but more typically by a 2D boundary or a 3D volume.
Further specializes a particular subclass of a Site by associating a custom Type that can be defined by users.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relates a Site to its Type definition

ECEntityClass.description: A volume occupied by a built facility, such as a building, bridge, road, factory/plant, railway, tunnel, etc.
Further specializes a particular subclass of a Facility by associating a custom Type that can be defined by users.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relates a Facility to its Type definition

ECEntityClass.description: A volume that breaks a Facility down into major parts that are larger than Spaces. Its meaning varies widely depending on the kind of Facility, but for Buildings it is a Storey.
Further specializes a particular subclass of a FacilityPart by associating a custom Type that can be defined by users.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relates a FacilityPart to its Type definition

ECEntityClass.description: A volume bounded either physically or virtually that provides for some function within a FacilityPart, Facility, or Site. Specific meanings vary depending on the kind of Facility, but Spaces tend to represent Rooms or important functional portions of Rooms within a Storey.
Further specializes a particular subclass of a Space by associating a custom Type that can be defined by users.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relates a Space to its Type definition

ECEntityClass.description: Defines a region of space associated with a specific purpose. As an ISpatialOrganizer, it may explicitly 'hold' or 'reference' SpatialElements.
Further specializes a particular subclass of a Zone by associating a custom Type that can be defined by users.

ECProperty.description: A human-readable description of this Zone Type.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relates a Zone to its Type definition

Deprecated.Description: Instead, use the SpatialStructureElementAggregatesSpatialStructureElements relationship that is a subclass of this relationship for backwards compatibility.

ECEntityClass.description: DEPRECATED: A spatial element that may be Composite of other CompositeElements

Deprecated.Description: Instead, use the SpatialStructureElement class that is a subclass of this class for backwards compatibility.

ECNavigationProperty.description: The aggregator of this element within the Spatial Structure

ECProperty.description: The area that this Element projects onto its base plane.

ECEntityClass.description: DEPRECATED: An optional interface that indicates that the CompositeElement is delimited by a curve

Deprecated.Description: Deprecated along with CompositeElement so its use is no longer recommended.

ECEntityClass.description: DEPRECATED: An optional interface that indicates that the CompositeElement is delimited by a volume

Deprecated.Description: Deprecated along with CompositeElement so its use is no longer recommended.

ECRelationshipClass.description: DEPRECATED: A relationship that indicates an element is at least partially contained within the CompositeElement

Deprecated.Description: Use the SpatialOrganizerHoldsSpatialElements or SpatialOrganizerReferencesSpatialElements relationships instead.
